Detailed Description

Abstract base class for easy generation of complex user properties.

UNDER CONSTRUCTION!!! DO NOT USE!!!

Member Function Documentation

virtual bool wxUserProperty::CopyValueFromControl (  wxPGCtrlClass *  primary  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Whenever value displayed on editor control(s) should be updated, this method is called.

Remarks:
  • Default behaviour is to expect primary to be wxTextCtrl (or wxCustomTextCtrl), and call SetValueFromString() on its contents.
  • Only called if primary window was created and returned by CreateEditor (thus, secondary window should never display any part of the property value).
  • primary is always NULL if this is called on behalf of a sub-property which was modified and thus affected this property as well.
Return values:
TRUE if value in control was different.

Reimplemented from wxPGProperty.

virtual wxPGCtrlClass* wxUserProperty::CreateEditor (  wxPropertyGrid *  propgrid,
const wxPoint &  pos,
const wxSize &  sz,
wxPGCtrlClass **  secondary
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Creates editor widget(s) for property.

Usually occurs when property is selected.
Creates 0-2 widgets, of which second, if any, is returned via psecondary parameter.
Secondary widget is usually a button on the right side of editor area. If only the button is created, then it should be returned as secondary, and primary should be NULL. Secondary must always be on the right side of primary.
Use parent->Connect(...) calls to setup event handling.

Parameters:
parent Parent wxPropertyGrid.
pos Position to create widget(s).
sz Size of area to create widget(s).
psecondary Pointer to wxPGCtrlClass* which should receive secondary widget.
Return values:
wxPGCtrlClass* to the primary editor widget.
Remarks:
Even if value type of property was string, GetValueAsString does not necessarily add same string as GetValue.

Reimplemented from wxPGProperty.

virtual int wxUserProperty::GetParentingType (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Returns 0 for normal items.

1 for categories, -1 for other properties with children, -2 for wxParentProperty (mostly like -1 ones but with few expections).

Remarks:
Should not be overridden by new custom properties.

Reimplemented from wxPGPropertyWithChildren.
